comments:
An invalid thread access is occuring (continuously :)) on background saves of the task list in today's (Feb 22) dev build running in 3.2M5.

Some relevant information may be that I use a central location for my task list and switch between two workspaces (the workspaces are not active simultaneously).

Here is the .log entry:

!SESSION 2006-02-22 14:24:08.748 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060217-1115
java.version=1.5.0_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Command-line arguments:  -data 
<munch on data location>

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2006-02-22 14:24:25.292
!MESSAGE Bad extension specification

!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist 4 0 2006-02-22 14:24:25.522
!MESSAGE startup class must implement org.eclipse.ui.IStartup

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-02-22 14:29:26.135
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Saving Task Data".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3349)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3272)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3243)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.error(Display.java:974)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.checkDevice(Display.java:634)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.getActiveShell(Display.java:1106)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasklist.util.TaskListSaveManager.saveRequested(TaskListSaveManager.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasklist.util.BackgroundSaveTimer$SaveJob.run(BackgroundSaveTimer.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Thanks for reporting this.  While it should be innocuous, it pointed out a minor startup issue.  It would be great if you could try out a developer build that I'll post in about an hour to ensure this or similar messages don't pop up, since your workspace is the only one I know of that has exhibited them.
